summary: High quality re-texture of all vanilla mage and mage related robes, hoods and boots.
descriptionHtml:
[font=century gothic][color=Red][u][b][size=+3]EcthelionOtW Mage Robes of Skyrim[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/IyZi3vVl.jpg[/IMG]


[font=century gothic][color=YELLOW][u][b][size=+2]About this Mod[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]


[size=+1][color=lightblue]
This mod represents the second step of my popular [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/40592]EcthelionOtW Mage Equipment Overhaul[/url] and includes new high quality texture replacers for all of the classical vanilla mage and mage related robes and offers all of the previously released robes + Thalmor, Greybeard, Psijic and Mythic Dawn in one single consolidated download pack. These robes have been created in collaboration with my friend misslexi to give these essential robes for every mage character a new, interesting and more attrative look.

The vanilla robes have been overhauled with new lore-friendly ornamental cloth textures and re-fined leather and metal parts. We have tried to stick as much as we could to Bethesda's color and material choice for their robes - you will be familiar with all of them , but find they are much more pleasant to look at now. Even if you don't ever play as a mage you may find these things appealing since a vast number of NPC's use them such as mages, priests, Thalmor and others.

In addition to the vanilla robes we have also covered the red and green robes from Heartfire DLC.

All the textures have been professionally compressed and are at the same size as Bethesda's official High Res DLC. They work for both genders and all races and should be compatible with any body conversion out there.

About the looks of it images can say more than thousand words of mine - especially since I have the honour to have some of the greatest screenarchers on the Nexus as regular beta testers for my work. Be sure to check out their remarkable work in the gallery on this front page and in the image section of this mod. I also recommend to watch the beautiful review videos below to see how these items look ingame.

For shots of the College and Long Robes please refer to their standalone pages :

[URL=http://imgur.com/l1iydJg][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/l1iydJgs.jpg[/IMG][/URL]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/49110]EotW Mage Equipment Overhaul - College Robes[/url]

[URL=http://imgur.com/RPYb5nB][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/RPYb5nBs.jpg[/IMG][/URL]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/49569]EotW Mage Equipment Overhaul - Long Robes[/url][/size][/color]


[font=century gothic][color=YELLOW][u][b][size=+2]Video Reviews[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]

[youtube]FL8fW-6b5VE#t[/youtube]
by hodilton ( just one robe as an example)


[font=century gothic][color=YELLOW][u][b][size=+2]Requirements[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]


[size=+1][color=lightblue]Skyrim 1.9+ is required for this mod to work. The optional Hearthfire pack which includes the red and green robe sets requires Hearthfire DLC.[/size][/color].


[font=century gothic][color=YELLOW][u][b][size=+2]Installation[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]


[size=+1][color=lightblue]
Download the mod file and extract the file into your skyrim directory, e.g. C:Program Files (x86)SteamSteamAppscommonskyrimData and say "yes" when being asked to integrate and override or simply use NMM.[/size][/color]


[font=century gothic][color=YELLOW][u][b][size=+2]Un-installation[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]


[size=+1][color=lightblue]Delete the file via NMM or manually by deleting the files contained in the mod folder within your Skyrim "Textures" folder.[/size][/color]


[font=century gothic][color=YELLOW][u][b][size=+2]Compatibility[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]


[size=+1][color=lightblue]The mod has no compatibility issues except with other mods that modify the same textures.[/size][/color]



[font=century gothic][color=YELLOW][u][b][size=+2]The Robe Gallery[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]


[size=+1][color=lightblue]Since we have quite a big amount of items covered I've decided to present them in an unabridged gallery provided by my wonderful beta testers. It shows the 4 newly introduced robe sets. Links to their other works can be found further down this page. A comprehensive style chart of all covered robes by misslexi can be found in the image section of this mod.


[/size][/color]

[font=century gothic][color=YELLOW][u][b][size=+2]Credits[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]


[size=+1][color=lightblue]Credits go to...

- maymay1588 along with a big thank you for the fixed Mythic Dawn robe meshes
- someone special for being there and an invaluable inspiration
- Bethesda for creating the gaming masterpiece Skyrim, Dawnguard and Dragonborn DLC and the HD texture packs
- Professor Tolkien who made a fact-loving lawyer and historician believe in magic again, the day I discovered his unique and ever outstanding work back in 2001
- Peter Jackson and WETA Workshop for being a great inspiration for this mod
- Lana del Rey, Howard Shore, Harry Gregson-Williams, Richard Wagner, Giacomo Puccini and others for helping me through endless hours of modding work

and last but absolutely not least to my fantastic group of friends and beta testers :[/size][/color]

[size=+1][color=lightblue]The gallery on this front page is a tribute to YOU and your contribution, your friendly help and encouragement and as well to your inspiring and outstanding modding and screenarchery work. I would not be modding anymore without you! THANK YOU SO MUCH![/size][/color]


[font=century gothic][color=YELLOW][u][b][size=+2]Permissions[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]


[size=+1][color=lightblue]This file is a NEXUS EXCLUSIVE and may not be ported to other sites!!!
You are not allowed to use any assets of this mod whithout my permission.[/size][/color]



[font=century gothic][color=YELLOW][u][b][size=+2]Author's note[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]


[size=+1][color=lightblue]If you like this mod please take a second to show your apprechiation or leave a comment or load up a picture - I'd be really grateful for it, since I have put many hours of work and a lot of determination into it. If you enjoy a mod a few clicks should not be too much to ask for. If you face any issues please let me know, so that we may find a solution.
[/size][/color]
author: EcthelionOtW and misslexi
